contextId.information: Here the word "anger" can be expressed as a verb. There are two possibilities for who is angry here: 1) The Moabite soldiers. AT: "So the Moabite soldiers were very angry with Israel" or 2) God. AT: "So God was very angry with Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: So there was great anger against Israel

contextId.information: The word "zeal" may be expressed as an adjective. AT: "and see how zealous I am" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

These two phrases mean the same thing and are repeated for emphasis. The abstract noun "oppression" means the same as "the king of Aram was oppressing them." AT: "he saw how severely the king of Aram was oppressing Israel"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: he saw the oppression of Israel, how the king of Aram was oppressing them

contextId.information: The abstract noun "death" can be expressed with the verb "die." AT: "until the day he died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: to the day of his death

contextId.information: The abstract noun "support" can be translated with the verb "support." AT: "so that Pul might support him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: so that Pul's support might be with him
